title.value: Graphylo: A deep learning approach for predicting regulatory DNA and RNA sites from whole-genome multiple alignments
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated in the article as 'Graphylo: A deep learning approach for predicting regulatory DNA and RNA sites from whole-genome multiple alignments'.
title.quote: Graphylo: A deep learning approach for predicting regulatory DNA and RNA sites from whole-genome multiple alignments

extractions.description: This paper introduces Graphylo, a deep learning model that predicts regulatory DNA and RNA sites by integrating convolutional neural networks for DNA sequences with graph convolutional networks for phylogenetic trees. It leverages evolutionary information across species using whole-genome multiple alignments.

type.justification: The research involves experimental evaluation of the Graphylo model compared to other models, demonstrating its performance in predicting transcription factor binding sites.
type.quote: We evaluated Graphylo against several state-of-the-art machine learning models... Performance was measured using area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUROC) for the RBP binding task and the area under the precision-recall curve (AUPR) for the TF binding task on a held-out test set.

name.justification: The paper focuses on predicting regulatory sites in the genome using computational models and genomic data.
name.quote: Graphylo is among the first deep learning approach to fully take advantage of deep multiple genome alignments to enhance the prediction of regulatory functional regions.

name.justification: The study concentrates on predicting transcription factor binding sites, which are crucial for understanding regulatory mechanisms in genomics.
name.quote: This study focuses on enhancing the prediction of regulatory functional sites in DNA and RNA sequences, a crucial aspect of gene regulation.

name.justification: The research applies machine learning techniques, specifically deep learning, to solve problems in the genomic domain.
name.quote: Graphylo, a deep-learning approach for predicting transcription factor binding sites in the human genome.

name.justification: Graphylo is explicitly named as the model introduced and utilized in the paper.
name.quote: Graphylo: A deep learning model that... combines a CNN for individual sequence representation with Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs).

is_contributed.justification: Graphylo is the main contribution of the paper, as indicated by the detailed exploration and introduction of the model.
is_contributed.quote: Here, we introduce Graphylo, a deep learning model that operates on a set of orthologous placental mammal sequences...

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses the execution and testing of Graphylo against baseline models.
is_executed.quote: We evaluated Graphylo against several state-of-the-art machine learning models...

is_compared.justification: Graphylo's performance is compared against multiple state-of-the-art models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: Graphylo, FactorNet+PhastCons, and PhyloPGM compared with the baseline FactorNet model for TF binding prediction.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Graphylo is a new contribution in the paper and is not derived from or referenced to an existing paper.

name.justification: FactorNet is mentioned as a baseline model used in comparisons with Graphylo.
name.quote: We evaluated Graphylo against several state-of-the-art machine learning models that operate on single-species data: (1) FactorNet...

is_contributed.justification: FactorNet is used as a baseline model and is not a contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We evaluated Graphylo against several state-of-the-art machine learning models... (1) FactorNet, a top-performing single-species TFBS predictor...

is_executed.justification: The execution of FactorNet in the context of this paper is not explicit, it is used for comparative analysis.

is_compared.justification: FactorNet is used as a baseline model for comparing Graphylo's performance.
is_compared.quote: Graphylo outperforms state-of-the-art single-sequence models such as FactorNet.

referenced_paper_title.value: FactorNet: a deep learning framework for predicting cell type specific transcription factor binding from nucleotide-resolution sequential data
referenced_paper_title.justification: Referenced as a state-of-the-art model in the comparative analysis section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: FactorNet, a top-performing single-species TFBS predictor in a recent DREAM competition...

name.value: ENCODE DREAM in vivo Transcription Factor Binding Site Prediction Challenge data
name.justification: This dataset is used for training and evaluating Graphylo's performance on transcription factor binding predictions.
name.quote: The Graphylo model was trained and evaluated using transcription factor binding data from the ENCODE DREAM in vivo Transcription Factor Binding Site Prediction Challenge.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper title referenced for this publicly available dataset as per the text.

name.value: RNA binding protein dataset by Strazar et al.
name.justification: This RNA binding dataset is mentioned as part of the data used in the paper's experiments.
name.quote: We used PARCLIP, HITS_CLIP, and ICLIP datasets initially curated by Strazar et al.

referenced_paper_title.value: Orthogonal matrix factorization enables integrative analysis of multiple RNA binding proteins
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is attributed to Strazar et al. for RNA binding experiments.
referenced_paper_title.quote: RNA binding protein dataset by Strazar et al.

name.justification: TensorFlow is a widely used library for building and deploying machine learning models, including deep learning models like Graphylo.
name.quote: Tensorflow large-scale machine learning on heterogeneous systems. tensorflow.org.

referenced_paper_title.value: Tensorflow: Large-scale machine learning on heterogeneous systems
referenced_paper_title.justification: Referenced as part of the computational framework used to implement the models.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Tensorflow large-scale machine learning on heterogeneous systems. tensorflow.org.
